meanings.definition: A triangular sail set on a ship's aftermost mast.
meanings.sent1: The moonsail fluttered gently in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The sailors hoisted the moonsail to catch the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The moonsail looked like a giant kite floating in the sky.
meanings.sent4: As the moonsail billowed, the ship surged forward.
meanings.sent5: The moonsail, with its sharp angles, added a touch of elegance to the ship.

meanings.definition: To set a moonsail on a ship.
meanings.sent1: They moonsail the ship before every voyage.
meanings.sent2: Sailors moonsail the vessel to increase speed.
meanings.sent3: I moonsail my toy boat in the bathtub for fun.
meanings.sent4: The captain moonsailed the ship expertly through the storm.
meanings.sent5: Moonsailing the ship requires skill and precision.

meanings.definition: The aftermost sail on a ship's mizzenmast.
meanings.sent1: The moonsail at the back of the ship caught the last bit of wind.
meanings.sent2: The moonsail on the mizzenmast helped steer the ship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the moonsail and squawked loudly.
meanings.sent4: Under the moonsail, the crew gathered for a late-night chat.
meanings.sent5: The moonsail on the mizzenmast was the sailors' favorite spot to relax.
